content: Incredible!!! Very well done. Polished too! EDIT: The updates keep coming and (ahh yeaaa) coming. I had a RL event take me away from gaming and when I came back I am more than satisfied. The surprises keep on co(u)m(m)ing.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! :D

content: big fan of your work

I loved this game despite frequent crashes. However my issue has now become the crashes. Game crashed while sailing and nothing loaded yet. Now having deleted that playthrough and started a new one, app won't load. I'd like a refund, prefer things to be fixed.

Amazing game but every time I download it and play it for a few days, it eventually freezes up and every time I open it- it's just the RAR logo and it never loads :( Thanks for responding! I love your game so much ❤️
replyContent: Thanks for the review!!! I'll try to figure out why this can be happening, will try to improve the performance in next updates :D

content: So great. Gives me the warm retro fuzzies. But wow is this game HARD.

I love this game, I love all of these games, they are fun and not overly complicated, no fancy graphics that lag out my phone, it's offline and can be played anywhere from home or on break at work. However, why four stars? Because I am having an issue, this game lags randomly and it's crashed on me a few times! And when I reload it was the last place I slept so I have to do all that jazz over again ;-; if I find a fix or an update fixes it, 5 stars, easy!
RAR was amazing and RAR II is even more so! What an immersive and thoughtful adventure game series. You keep making them, and I'll keep buying!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! I wish I can do more games in a short future! :D

content: gwoovy
replyContent: Thanks!!

content: I was looking for a rogue-like MEANT for android, and this is it! Interface is great. I wish things were a bit more than bare-bones though - need things like crit chance, thorough battle log (why did I do X damage?), beast dictionary, damage vulnerabilities/resistances, help catalog with definitions, better descriptions (how much dmg does a bomb do?), dungeons with traps, moving enemies, and water/lava, more open areas with less enemies but more sights and descriptions, etc.
replyContent: Thanks!!! That was one of my main purposes back in the day when I started with RAR I, and tried to continue with this one. Glad you like it! :)

content: Love this game a lot! Insert your own character persona as you would a pen and paper RPG and it's awesome!
replyContent: Thanks!!!! :D

content: I played the first one a TON and this one is everything and more. So happy I went back to find the first after a few years and saw RAR II. If you like roguelike games, or even just open world RPGs, and dont mind the text based theme it's definitely worth a try. This one is so cool with the different classes, pets, character types and, sailing to new biomes to find new things. You can even enter dungeons that are different mini maps with bosses. To the dev, this blew me away, major props! :D<3
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your super nice review!!! Really glad you enjoy it! <3

content: This is an amazing game, well balanced and fun
replyContent: Thanks!!!!

content: Best roguelike on marketplace imo. The next step up would be multiplayer
Fantastic game!
replyContent: Thanks!! :)

content: Oh imagination and declarative gaming, how've I missed you! Also, I enjoy the music.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!! :D

content: Best game ever!
replyContent: Hahaha thanks a lot!! :p

content: Reminds me of dwarf fortress.
replyContent: It was inspired by some games and one of them was Dwarf Fortress! <3

content: Great game. There's a bit of steep learning curve and it can get tedious to restart repeatedly if you keep getting bad luck on getting attacked/escaping and die early on. However, it's definitely fun to try out lots of the species/classes, and trying to strategize bit by bit to get a little further each run is the good part of the game. One thing - I play on 2 different devices, and it would be nice to be able to sync between them, or at least export/import saves to keep playing the same game regardless of device.
replyContent: Glad you like it!!!! :D PS About export/import saves I tried some time ago and wasn't able to do it due to some technical issues, but in future projects I'll definitely try to do that :D

content: Extremely good job by the dev of this game. The ascii graphics reminds me of a better time. My only complaint is that the game is extremely hard really early in the game. I do not remember being so frustrated because I am constantly doing at level 1-2. Nevertheless so much love has been put in this product and its showing.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! I hope with the latest updates the game got a little bit easier at the start! Also, maybe try different strategies to start (if you seek for advice, I recommend joining the Discord channel where people are always willing to share their tips and tricks! :D). Good luck!!! <3

content: Seems cool
replyContent: Thanks!! :)

content: Amazing game, wish their was a leaderboard.
replyContent: Thanks!!!! I may try to do something like that in the future or in future projects, for sure!!! :D

content: Excellent roguelike with tons of variety. Interface is well designed and easy to use. ASCII graphics provide retro styling to what feels like a modern text-based RPG. The developer has obviously put a lot of love into his creation.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!!! <3<3<3

content: Love it.
Good game.
replyContent: Thanks!!! :)

content: Extremely difficult, lots of dying and trying again, perfect balance of luck and skill. Played v1 for years so this was a no brainer purchase. Would love to see an option to make the directions/tab buttons a bit bigger (small screen, meaty thumbs) and maybe a key for the map squares & the option to set our own interest points? A little music overlap bug but not game breaking, just plays the soundtrack again over itself out of time.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!!! I take note of the issues you comment! :)

content: Good game, just like the last one. However, i feel like tool recipes could be made alot cheaper or learnable through quests and the spell wind push costs a ton compared to the damage it deals.
replyContent: Thanks for the review!!!! Tool recipes can be dropped randomly like the other recipes, I hope you find some, if not, at some point you'll earn more gold (in greater level islands, for sure!) and about the spell, I'll review it, thanks!! :D

content: I really like the game, the only problem is, why is it everytime i left another island then go back i receive less experience points, sometimes I don't receive any points, please fix this. Thanks:)
replyContent: Hi! Thanks for the review! Will try to see if I can adjust it a little bit, at least in the first island, so it's a not so hard beginning of the game :)

content: Dope.
replyContent: Thanks!!! :)

content: Good for what it is. If graphics are your thing & you hate grinding, then this game is not for you. Personally, I found that just as I can forget that the old movie I'm watching is monochrome, I can just as easily forget that I'm playing an rpg/dungeon crawler that has no pictures & is made entirely of ASCII text.
replyContent: Thanks for the nice review!!! I'm glad you enjoy it :D

content: Not as enjoyable as the first one.
replyContent: Hi! I would really love to hear your thoughts about it and the feedback, please, send me an email or contact me in Discord if you can, so I can try to figure out what makes it less enjoyable than the first one from your point of view :D Thanks a lot!!

content: Its Amazing. One of the best roguelike game.
replyContent: Thank you very much for this!!! :D

content: Five stars well deserved.
replyContent: Thanks!!!! :D

content: It's a great game, makes a whole bunch of improvements to the original, which was already super good. I just started it yesterday, and the only problem I'm having is that I don't know which tiles I've explored after using that item that shows every tile on the island. Maybe unexplored tiles that you can still see should be greyed out so you know if they've already been stepped on. Also, do you think multiplayer would ever be possible?
replyContent: Thanks for your review! In theory, regarding the map usage, if you have the "squares enabled" from the settings, you should be able to differentiate them from grey (unexplored) to white (explored). I hope this helps! About multiplayer, for this game I don't think it'd be possible, but I'd love to do something like that in future projects ;)

content: Thoroughly addicting! I just lost 4 hours and I don't care!
replyContent: Thanks!!! And, sorry? 😊

content: Fun
replyContent: Thanks!! :)

content: Good Game but Poor Rogue Like. One of the most important aspects of a roguelike is the permadeath feature, and IMO this game isn't fun with it enabled. I think what is missing is the lack of character uniqueness. I have a strategy I like for this game and it works every game even if I vary the race or class. it feels like the same character. I think there are two and a half reasons for this. Primarily lack of spell uniqueness. I can't tell the difference between most spells. Already at 500 chars
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback!! I'll think how I can improve the game in these aspects! Feel free to reach out to me with suggestions, via email or in Discord. Thanks!! :)

content: Great game for anyone old enough to have played old school MUDs. Great concept and execution!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! <3

content: Too convoluted for it's own good, Laggy also considering the lack of any color. Takes random way too far, good there's chicken mode for beginning. Just me but I don't know about the dieing and retrying in rogue likes, dang I wanted to like this game. Worth $3 ? If you don't mind running in circles...
replyContent: Hello! You could try the no-permadeath mode, this way you can continue in the last checkpoint. I suggest joining Discord to get some good tips and tricks on how to get started, people are very friendly and active there and help new players get started :) Thanks for the feedback anyway :)

content: The base system is here but you hardly have anything to do other than fetch quests and escort quests. The balance is ridiculous as well. I was never in a state of being on par with the challenges but rather I was either 1-shotting or being 1shot. For a permadeath game, that's just not good enough. At least its not running adds.
replyContent:
Hi! The game sometimes can feel unbalanced, but I would suggest trying to not attack monsters of higher level than yours, and trying to buy better equipment, maybe capture a pet, or buy some spells. There are also skills that can help 
:) (There's also a no-permadeath mode in case you didn't see in the "new game" screen) Thanks for the feedback! :)

content: I love the unique concept, but the execution is lacking. Character creation teases you with lots of unique abilities, but once you actually get into the game, combat feels far too simple for any of your choices to matter. You also have to flee from virtually every monster, because the cost to heal at an inn is far higher than the rewards you get from combat. The developer seems very kind and willing to act on feedback, so I'd be happy to change my review if the gameplay improves.
replyContent: Hi! Yeah, I'm open to try to improve the game further, I guess I still need to tweak the balance here and there, but meanwhile, I would suggest trying a different combination of race/advantage to not having to go to an Inn so often. The Discord channel there's plenty of tips and tricks! I would recommend joining and reading some of them! Thanks! :)

content: I played the first game and had already fell in love with it, once this game came out i knew it was going to be good so spent the money right away to get it and i was right! The game is awesome, No ads, it has a main story quest along with side quest, you can chose to have perma death on for a more harder mode or off to just explore and enjoy the game, the movement system is nice along with the attacking system and above all its a great time killer, nothing is ever really the same
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your nice review!!! I'm glad you like the improvements over the first one!! <3

content: Once i reached the menu that lists the islands for the first time, i realized how serious and real and legit this roguelike is. After i died during that run, upon being prompted by character creator menu again, I realized how Dark Souls-like it functions, and i was SUPER impressed and humbled. This game is like. SanctuaryRPG + dwarf fortress (for babies like me) + dark souls influenced, sophisticated turnbased combat. yup. This game and Cardinal Quest 2. The top dogs of mobile @.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for this!!! Yes, I had some influences from various games, Dwarf Fortress is one of them for sure, and roguelikes in general (also some influences from other genres and even MUDs in general :D). Thanks!! <3

content: I absolutely adore this game. The first one was amazing and this one improved upon it wonderfully. I just purchased the full version after maxing out the demo. My one complaint is that I love my demo character and there is no option to import my save! :( Is there a workaround to bring my demo wizard into the full game? I feel like I've wasted a lot of time because I went around farming gold and stuff to improve my gear and unlock recipes.
replyContent: I'm so sorry to read that, I didn't think about that, and I think, given the fact it's two separated games there may be some technical difficulties to do that. But I take note for the future… My apologies for that. Thanks a lot for your super nice review and I hope you have great adventures with your new character 😅

content: Leagues beyond the first game. I'm impressed. A perfectly executed ASCII Roguelike experience.
replyContent: Thanks!!!!! <3

content: UPDATE REVIEW: It seems like each island you uncover(first time you sail/spawn an island) it's level is the same as player - 1. So I was lvl 9 on first island, and second became lvl 8... It's quite sad tbh, since grinding is pointless and technically I can get stuck(if I grind to higher level, but my items stay at their respective level(wood/iron, some rare diamond), then I could probably not make it.) I wish there was a "main story" and island levels were based on that. Perhaps 2 game modes(story mode vs endless(current mode seems to be endless, I could be wrong tho)) Played first version few years back. Seeing that the dev updated the old one and made the second, I bought it without even trying out the demo. Price is good, game is definitely worth it. Got a weird issue tho, game setting by default have English language, but the game menu appears to be auto translated to my local language used on the device. I had to switch to different one(e.x. Spanish) which restarted the game, then change it back to English and after restart the game runs in English.
replyContent: Thanks for your super feedback!! I'm aware there seems to be some sort of bug regarding the language changing, I have it in my long to do list, will try to figure it out soon :) About main story and endless mode, actually the game is both at the same time: the game is "endless" and there is a main story :p Thanks again for your kind words!!

content: Amazing game, its a good substitute for a dnd style. We honestly need more games like this, RNG worlds and all. Just, maybe give a reason to play perma death? (I haven't played long. Maybe an hour at least) but like, if you die you gain a minor buff. Just so its not depressing and aggravating when you die. Besides that, 3$ so far well spent!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! I think the Permadeath mode is for players who want to feel the danger of dying for good, it makes it more… challenging and interesting I guess :D I recommend playing no permadeath if you don't want to lose all your progress :) Thanks for the review!!!

content: I dont know what the point of this game is aside from dying
replyContent: I would say the journey is the reward :D If you are dying too much, I would recommend joining the Discord community and reading some of the awesome tips and tricks some players are giving there :) Thanks for the review!!

content: Great game by a great dev. Played the original game and only just decided to upgrade to 2. Wish I had sooner. The amount of detail and content is fantastic and keeps the game feeling fresh with each playthrough. Keep up the great work!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! Glad you are enjoying it!!!!

content: Worth the money. A great timekiller with a lot of work put into it.
replyContent: Thanks!!!! :D

content: This games ability to have such a simple design but in depth rpg mechanics blows me away. The game is fun and starting over is a blast since there are so many new ways to start again. I recommend it to anyone who loves a good rpg
replyContent: I'm glad you like it and enjoy it!!! :D

content: 1. Storyline and quests. 2. Randomly generated islands of several different biomes. 3. Secrets to discover. 4. Challenging. I play on permadeath mode and it is a fun and a good way to make sure you dont play too much. I tend to play for hours on end, but when you die at level 50, it makes you take a break. Still has a lot of replayability: you can restart with a different race and strategy. Exactly what I want. One downside currently is the app gets a little laggy after being open for hours.
replyContent: Thankss!!!!!! About the lag, I'm trying to figure out how to improve it but it seems not an easy thing to fix, I'll do my best :D <3

content: Absolutely amazing. An absolute must-play if you like roguelikes! Deceptively deep and complex with a lot of systems and strategies to sink your teeth into! I cannot recommend this game enough. You've outdone yourself with RAR II!
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your nice review!!! I'm glad you like it! :D

content: I didn't care for loosing half my gold and starting over and you start so weak even after the store, I should be able to kill things easy, and not being able to adjust that or have it more balanced towards being easier stresses me out and I didn't wanna pay two fifty for more stress
replyContent: Hello Chapin! Sorry to read this… Did you try the Chicken mode? And/or maybe a different combination of race and starting advantage? Some of them are easier than others! :) I would also recommend joining the Discord channel and ask for some tips and tricks to get started! I hope you give it a try!

content: My pet should not receive the same level of EXP as I do if it is 10 levels below me. So far I see no reason to have more than 1 pet, and if I find something stronger, but lower level, I can't raise it up because everything it's level gives it 0 or 1 exp... That's not right..
replyContent: Hello! There was a conversation around this in Discord, and you are right, this is an issue I will fix as soon as I can :) Thanks for pointing this out! :D

content: It's fun because playing it is a bit like reading a book with a very good interface. It's a fair balanced RPG without any monetization scheme. Also you can quit anytime and current progress is saved. Perfect for short bursts of play. Of course it's playable completely offline! Well done.
replyContent: Thank you for the nice review!! I'm glad you enjoy it! :D

content: Amazing
replyContent: Thank you! :)

content: Exceptionally great game!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!!! :D

content: Great adaptation of old MUDs for modern devices. A lot of work has gone in to improving RARII from the first installment and the developer's passion is evident. Thank you!
replyContent: Thanks!!!! I really wanted to give it the vibe from the old MUDs and adapt it to the Android devices, I'm glad you like it and I appreciate the review :D

content: This game is extremely addictice and I rather enjoy my playthrough a smebulock the gnome!
replyContent: Thanks a lot! And good luck, Smebulock the Gnome!

content: Good game, although there is one problem in my opinion: "normal" mode is... Kind of impossible. I know, you added chicken mode, but the fact that most of the monsters can 4-5 shot you is bad when the map is covered with them, so if you choose a weak class, they can't level up because you can only get exp from killing the monsters which already can 4 shot you. Also, tools are overpriced to buy and repair. So reduce the damage of some of the hard hitting monsters and make tools cheaper.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! I'll think about what can I do to improve the weaker races, but, meanwhile, I would recommend to join the Discord and ask around for tips and tricks on how to have a better start, there are many strategies being commented there (many of them I didn't even think of hehe). I hope you give it a try and enjoy it more! :D

content: Great game. Lots of fun for those who enjoy a good grindy rpg. Glad to see a function to turn off perma death. I do sometimes kinda wish i could have graphics even if they were crude, but it doesnt detract from a great game.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for the review!!! :)

content: Great game. I loved the first one, and was happy to spend some money on the second. My only gripe is I'd like to have some sort of legend or something to tell me what things are. I like the challenging gameplay, even if it sometimes seems a bit unfair. That's what makes it random!
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your feedback!!! Glad you enjoy it :D

content: Really fun game, with weeks of replay-ability and a great community. The developer welcomes new players in the discord, hangs out and chats, real nice guy. Happy to support a project and developer like this. <3
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! I'm just amazed at having this awesome community talking about the game there,  even some players know more about the game strategies than me :P

content: Great game. Loved the first one. As soon as I found out there was a second, I got it.10/10
replyContent: Thanks!!! Glad you love it!!! :D

content: Awesome game. I was a bit timid to install it at first but I dont regret it now! GREAT JOB!!
replyContent: Thank you!!!!! :)

content: Great classic roguelike for mobile.
replyContent: Thanks!!!! :D

content: My new favorite game!
replyContent: my new favorite review! :p

content: So I have a love hate relationship with this great game. I just died as my first over 10 character, Rarq, the Lizardman. He made it to 18 and died fighting an young silver dragon, trying to get his pet to take the killing blow, but the pet with its strongest attack didn't kill the dragon thus the dragon killed him. I am wounded, and conflicted, but will try again when I cool off... 10/10
replyContent: Hahaha but you can play No Permadeath mode if you don't want to lose all the progress! :P Thanks for the review Kenpachi! :)

content: Good. I only wish there was a wiki or something
replyContent: Thanks!!!

content: Very entertaining game. Old-school feeling. Has a interesting variety of contents for one to discover and master. Would recommend. Creator of the app also has an amazing discord server and actually takes time to listen to he's gamers suggestions and bug reports. Very responsive and quick to resolve issues. He has my respect. -Baron :)
replyContent: Thanks for the review Baron! And it's been a pleasure having had your help in the last days of the 1.0 beta! :D

content: I love this game so much. It is very well put together and offers more and more challenge the further in you go. I only wish there was a PC version.
replyContent: Thanks a lot Dylan!!! For now, and for RAR / RAR II I don't think it's very feasible to do a PC version, but I have different new projects in mind which may be in the future I try to do multiplatform, it's a matter of time :) Thanks for your feedback! :D

content: I loved every of your efforts on creating this game! I know that even though all of this might seem too simple, and it costs money that seems like it's not the rightful price for a simplistic game like this, i still know that you made this with all your heart & love. I'll happily support you in every way i can (i'm sorry that i can't talk much about everything else but know that i appreciate you, hehe).
replyContent: Thanks a lot and thanks for the support! I wasn't 100% sure about the pricing but at the end, I didn't want to do the IAP or watch ads model on this game, I preferred offering the full experience just by paying once, and I appreciate you said this :) In future projects, I may do it differently but, for me, RAR/RAR II is more than just games… <3

content: I have no idea how this game is so absolutely and incredibly addictive. This game is absolutely fantastic. It gets a bit repetitive once you start island hopping, but getting those sweet items and new spells and it's just awesome. Download it and see for yourself.
replyContent: Thanks a lot, Bryan!! I'm happy you like it and I'm trying to add more variety of things to do to make it less repetitive but it's one of the most difficult things to achieve. I'll try my best hehe Thanks again for the feedback! :)

content: Engaging and fun!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! :)

content: Exceeding expectations and outdid yourself here. Everything from the original has been improved, tightened, expanded, etc. I am excited to see the updates and each one adds more exciting aspects to an already flawless game! Your a dev after my own heart and I am 100% grateful you have shared your talents with us fellow geeks! I look forward to your future projects!
replyContent: Wow!!! Thanks a lot for this super nice feedback!! I'm really glad you enjoy it and hope you like it even more when the new update 1.0 comes out (almost ready!). Thank you!!!

content: Finally got this game after playing the first one for years!! When I started playing this I lost my mind lol although I'm not sure how to acquire pets?? Other than that it's the perfect game I've ever played!! Thanks for bringing this game to the top and keep up the good work⭐⭐⭐ Can't wait till this is completed and if there's a 3rd one thought up I'd definitely buy it lol
replyContent: Thanks Brian!!! I'm glad you like it! Get ready for update 1.0, it's almost finished, I hope I can update it soon :) about Pets, you are able to capture them with the Capture Monster spell which you can find in some Magic Shop. If not having luck, with 1.0 there will be a new Pet Shop where you will be able to find it (and even buy Pets!). Thanks!!

content: More depth and options than many roguelike phone games. This one does a great job of capturing the playstyle and feel of the old ascii roguelikes from the PC. Great fun. The musical score is excellent as well.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! I'm glad you like it, and really appreciate you like the music! <3

content: RAR II is an excellent roguelike. Somewhat reminds me of a lighter Omega. Plays beautifully on smallish and large screens. I would love to see a desktop adaptation. Worth every penny.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! I may do a new project in the future, a multiplatform one, so, yeah, maybe there's an evolution of this :D

content: Update: Enjoying the new classes would be interesting if there was a "worthless" class causing stats to drop. Finished the game as well. Have to say that I like the twist.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your review!!!!!! :) Update: Have you obtained a Dark Orb and found a usage for it? If not, let me tell you you still haven't finished the game hehe (and I'm working on the 1.0 update, with more end game content amongst other things :D )

content: This is a really good game. I have a suggestion, to possibly add a button to show users the nearest unexplored tile if they are having trouble with the dungeons Keep up the good work ☺️
replyContent: Thanks for your review Robbie! I've just answered your email! ;) We'll figure something out :D

content: This game, after figuring out the basics in a good amount of deaths, is very fun. Thank you for clarifying the auto-save!
replyContent: Thanks for your review! Right now, the game is always saving, every action you make is being saved, but if you are playing "Permadeath" mode, you lose everything when you die. In "No Permadeath" mode you'll be able to continue from the last "Checkpoint" saved (when resting in an Inn or leveling up, a checkpoint save is made). Hope this helps! :)

content: Fantastic game, Just like the first.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! :)

content: Great work
replyContent: Thanks!!! :)

content: Amazing. Came a long way from version 1.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!!! <3

content: Fun as always! Excellent game 👍👍
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! <3

content: I'm sorry, but I could easily be defeated (especially receiving large amount of damage from the enemies while I send them small amount of damage), not to mention I earn little golds, other resources and experiences. That's why my player is become Level 2.
replyContent: Hi! Have you tried different combinations of Race / starting Advantage? There are some easier than others :D If you want more advice, we are growing a nice community in Discord (link inside the app or in the subreddit). I hope you give it a try, I'm sure you'll get the hang of it soon! :) Thanks for the review!

content: This is a long overdue review, just leaving it here for fun. Just like the game. Fun.
replyContent: Thanks Charmander!!!!! :)

content: Wow, just wow! When I pulled up the original and saw it wasn't being updated anymore I was disappointed but then I picked this up. It expands on everything the first did but does it better in every way! If you're craving that old school gaming experience then this is the game for you. Fans of sandbox and true roguelikes should love this game. I never write reviews but wanted to spread the good word. Thank you for this game!
replyContent: Thank you very much for your super nice review!!!! I hope you continue enjoying it in the next updates I have planned! <3

content: It's OK. Has potential but unclear it will go further than the first. Not providing a real Changelog is not good. This is not a fishing pool for personal Discord subjects, we're paying customers.
replyContent: Thanks for your review! It's true, I should add a "Changelog" option in-game! I will try to do something like this in future updates, thanks for the idea! :)

content: So much fun easy for when at VA waiting all day at appts
replyContent: Thanks for your review!!!! :D

content: Interesting, fun, different. Would be interesting to see this idea expanded upon. Keep up the good work!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!!! :D

content: I love this game. Even visually impaired can play. I hope, many blind people like me can try also this awesome game. Just continue to improve it and i wish many games like this can be accessible by vocalizer and talk back. So, we can enjoy also and we can feel that we are not different
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your review Eljer!!!!! :D I hope I can continue bringing new things to the game and make it even better and more accessible! :)

content: I think you could have something special here especially with multiplayer.
replyContent: Thanks for the rating!!! I'd love to do a multiplayer game sometime in the future, it's a matter of time :D

content: Thank You ! Appreciate your update , loving the races. Please add more classes, you know like nethack or pathos . Tourists, explorer , convict , caveman, bard :) etc
replyContent:
I'm glad you like the update!

I may add some more in the future, and/or maybe improve the "classes", as it still feels it can be quite improved :)

Thanks for the feedback! :D

content: Great time sink, very well fleshed out, I've played since the first one and the developer is great. They have a subreddit and they seem to be really passionate about the game
replyContent: Thanks a lot for the review!!!!! :D

content: This is a very fun game, very distracting. Was a fan of the first game, am a fan of this one too.
replyContent: Thank you!!! I'm glad you came to the second one!!! :D

content: I've sailed on the boat after I've done everything on the first island, which meant the first new islands I've been to were at least level 7 , which meant that I either had to spend a LOT of time grinding on the first island for money and exp, or risk dying instantly on the second. Perhaps set the level of the second island fixed to 5 or smthing, therefore if people find the second one too hard, they can finish the first one, then smoothly to the second island.
replyContent:
Hi! Thanks for the review :)

About the islands' generation, they are always generated around the player level, to add a little bit of challenge when the player travels to new islands, not sure about fixing the level of the islands, but I will try to figure out how I can balance it even more in future updates, thanks!!

content: Exceptional. Feels like Diet Cave of Qud, but without the chewy exposition. I can't put it down. HELP ME!
replyContent: Hahaha thanks a lot!!!! I'm glad you are enjoying it!! :)

content: I realize this is a beta, but I'm just so excited to see the second installment of this beautiful series. The interface, music, class system, professions--everything seems to be a step up from RAR1... A GEM
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your super nice review!!! As a solo dev trying to make what I love, I really appreciate reviews like yours, thanks!!! <3

content: The game is very strange. It had clases with various functions (like a healer), but what's the point in having specialized classes if the game is single player? The first version of this game is better, since you're not pressed to find the best class for solo play.
replyContent: Hi!! Maybe I should explain it better in the new game screen, but, the selection is just for the beginning, choosing a class doesn't obligate you to be that type of character, it's just, to begin with an advantage :D (you can start as a Cleric, but after two minutes playing, you can become whatever you want to be, everything's possible! :D) Thanks!

content: Very promising game, from just a few minutes you can tell how much effort has been put into giving the game content. Id recommend an Easy mode, the difficulty is very astringent and requires quite a bit of planing, for those who want to wonder around without thinking an easy difficulty would be great.
replyContent: Thanks a lot! I will be updating the game soon with new features (Race selection amongst other things), which I hope it will give an easier start depending on the combination of Race and starting Class :) If that still feels too difficult, I have to think if adding an easy mode wouldn't break the game too much, but it's possible I do it :) Thanks!!

content: This game is exactly what I wanted: More Random Adventure Roguelike, with defined classes, offering various benefits. As wonderfully simple on the surface, and complex at the core, as I would both want and expect from the sequel. Five stars.
replyContent: Thank you!!! I'm glad you like it!! I hope you like even more the next updates I'm preparing :D Thanks for the nice review!! :)

content: A near perfect rogue-like with a subtle sense of humor. No frills and built for those who are concerned more with substance over style. A definite keeper in an overcrowded space.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your nice review!!!! :D

content: I've been a fan since part 1, this is definitely a diamond in the rough, very unique game and very challenging and fun. It's amazing how much enjoyment can be had with a bunch of words lol. Thank you for your hard work and dedication I will happily continue to support your efforts. And I truly believe a lot more ppl will if they only knew about it, we gotta get this game to a broader audience bro!
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your kind words!!! And I'm glad you were playing since RAR 1 :) I'd love to get this to a broader audience too hehe :D

content: The name says it all! Complexity of the game is what you make it. Play simply as a mere Warrior or try your hand using spells or pets with other classes. Loads of crafting recipes and ingredients, procedurally generated maps, quests, and constant updates from a dedicated developer.
replyContent: Thank you so much for this!!!! I'm glad you like it!!!! :D

content: Phenomenal! I've been following along with the development of RAR2 since RAR1! Love the dev's active engagement with the community and the possibilities for the future! It's already a lot of fun to play, but knowing how development has been going, I'm expecting this game to evolve into my favorite roguelike/rpg for both a quick coffee-break run, or hours long investment. I'm so excited to see new features and additions!
replyContent:
Thanks a lot for your super nice review!!! I'm glad you liked RAR 1 and RAR 2 too! :)

Yeah, I still have many things to add to RAR II, I hope I can continue making it better :D

content: Interesting concept. It's a steep learning curve for me but I am enjoying the challenge. It's a shout out to the old rpgs. However, I'm having trouble figuring out how to save. EDIT: I apologize, after creating a new character I read the checkpoint at the inn message. Great game, keep up the great work.
replyContent: Thanks for your review! By the way, the game saves each turn! The checkpoint is for the No Permadeath mode, so that's the restoring point in case of dying :) I'm glad you're enjoying the game!

content: This game is just what I needed to scratch my roguelike itch!
replyContent: Nice!!! Thanks for your comment!! :)

content: A nolstogic connection to RPGs of old. It reminds me a bit of RPGs I used to play on my Commodore 64, such as Ultima, Questron, and Demons Winter. Keep up the good work, I I am enjoying the game!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!! I'm glad you felt nostalgic, it's one of the main purposes of the game , so, I guess mission accomplished! :D

content: This is a fun simple rougelike! Great on the go!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! :D

content: I like it so far. Massive UI improvement over the first. A lot of the old cheesing strats dont work but thats okay, it's an interesting kind of different. I'd like to see what else you come up with.
replyContent:
Thanks a lot!!! I tried to improve the concept of the first one and add more stuff to it :)

Out of curiosity, what do you mean with the "old cheesing strats"? I'm not english native, and I'd really love to know what I can improve in the game! Feel free to send me an email with more details :D

Thanks!!! :)

content: I love this game so so much. so so much. I'm really excited to watch it grow with each update!!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!!! <3

content: Very good. Need dungeons to dive into with loot at the end.
replyContent: Thanks!! I'll try to add something like that in future updates :)

content: Hey man! I love RAR 1. I have not even opened the second yet, and yet I know I'll love it. How do I throw more of my moola at you? I'd love to support you/the game if I could. *Edit * I don't recieve class gifts when starting a new run
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!!! I'll review that! :)

content: Sorry to say I initially liked the premise, but it's very buggy, much of the game is irrelevant, combat is homogeneous despite overabundance of options, and ending is kindergarten fantasy. Achievement page went blank and never restored, game crashed every couple seconds at times. Needs rationale and utility for detail and better menu navigation. Required square mapping for purify is exercise in boredom. Animal quests clutter screen and never get completed. Died at lvl 106 after unbreakable fail.
replyContent: I'm sorry this happened to you, I'm working a lot on new features and trying to make it a better game, specially listening to feedback like yours :) I take note of your issues and I will keep improving it. I hope you can give it a new opportunity in next updates! I'd really appreciate more detailed feedback via email, if that's possible :) Thanks!

content: I have been waiting for somthing like this a very long time. it's an amazing piece soul. The developer is also kind and willing to help. The mobs are well balanced for new players but a little easy for an experienced player. I do hope the questing becomes more complicated and advanced as the story continues and game progresses in development. As for an early access new age area progressive MUD it's amazing!!!! I do hope to see an in-game community chat of sorts for active players. 5/5 stars!!!!
replyContent: Thank you very much for your super awesome review!!!!! I'm happy you like it!!! :D

content: I can dig it
replyContent: Thanks for the 5 stars :D

content: A very good game (and the only game on my phone since i'm not much of a gamer) but this game is very addictive and for people that loves to challenge themselves with hard games and are much into theorycraft, trying to make the most out of your skill, finding the best beginner class (priest) how to lose as little money as possible, how not to die (simple enough precharge multiple islands, gain 2 level, precharge another go to the last precharged island and repeat).
replyContent: Thank you very much!!!! I'm glad you enjoy it and thanks for the tips for the beginners :)

content: This is seriously one of the best RPG experiences on mobile. It has the graphicly simple/ gameplay complexity of a classic PC game. Yet, the interface is so well done and easy to pick up and play. Sorry about the gramatical errors, but I just can't sit back and not praise what the developer has done. Completly worth the money. I've spent more on so much less. Not regretting this purchase. I do wish there was a way to play a Theif like character, unlocking doors, finding traps, stealth options.
replyContent: <3 Thanks a lot for your super nice review!!! Omg, it really makes my day to read these reviews! Thanks!!! :D

content: I'm still getting used to the concept of some monsters being able to do big damage when they're lower levels, but it makes it that much more challenging when you really have to pay attention to your other skills and the armor you have equipped. It has so much to offer and I hope this keeps getting the attention it deserves! Thank you for a great game!
replyContent: Thank you for your nice review!!!! ;) And yes, I'm trying to find the balance between challenging and fun, it's the most difficult thing to do, so, I'm glad you are finding it great! :D

content: Love the flow, difficulty is just right.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your review! I'm glad you like the difficulty :D

content: There really aren't words to express how incredibly captivating RAR II really is. By far, the best text based game made in decades! Unlike tap and click, this one *will* grab you.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your super nice review Scott! Very glad you liked this new game!!! :D

content: Great job. Much fun. Theres no problem with early game level curve. You shouldnt be able to just beat everything @ lv1.
replyContent: Thanks for your review Kyle! And I'm glad you shared this!! :D

content: Looks like it might be fun, but its $2.99 just to try, and no one except the warrior getting anything useful at start really hurts. No description of anything in game.
replyContent: I'm really sorry you didn't like the game :'( I'm trying to do my best with the game and updating it often adding new features and improving it listening to the player's feedback. Why don't you join one of the communities (Discord or the subreddit) or you send me an email with some ideas on how to make it better :) Thanks in advance! :D Hello? :)

content: Nice concept, until you realize that virtually all of the mobs that you encounter are too strong for you and you can't obtain nearly enough gold to buy any decent equipment because what little gold you do manage to get is all being spent on keeping your character alive until about level 2, then it's pointless. An unbalanced cash grab for $2.99
replyContent: Hello Kurt! This is an early access game, and I'm working hard on it. I'm really sad you leave a bad review because I'm trying to make a better game by listening to the community (Reddit, Discord) and I thought the difficulty curve was okay for all of them. Could you send me an email so we can try to figure out how to improve it? Thanks! Hello? :)

content: Fun and great UI for mobile! Looking forward to further development!
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your review! :)

content: A challenging game where you have to balance earning money, going hungry, and staying alive. New updates keep making the game better. A good game for it's price! Some Requests: A in game change log. Info button in the crafting menu describing what the crafted item can do.
replyContent: Thanks for your review and suggestions! Will probably add the info button soon! The changelog I could think about it too, thank you! :)

content: Loving the game!
replyContent: Nice!!! :D

content: Ok I've played it for several hours non stop sense my original review. I must be doing something wrong because I'm having a hard time progressing and it seems like everything is expensive. I have lots of known recipes but gathering the resources or buying the tools (or crafting the tools needed to gather the resources to craft the tools) and then breaking so suddenly is maddening. Love this game 5* no questions about it. PC version on GOG for 1&2 would be awesome.
replyContent:
Glad you like it!!!! About tools breaking, keep control of the number next to the tool name, it indicates the uses left. You can use a Whetstone to repair it, and you can unlock the Efficient and Professional skills to have chances of a tool not wasting usages every time you use it :)

Thanks and hope you have fun with the game! :D

content: I played a lot of browser based games when i was a kid, and this is exactly the type of game i was looking for. Totally worth buying this game! Hopefully the dev can add more features to this game in the future, like more random events and encounters.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!! I'm happy you found my game and you enjoy it! There's still a lot of things I'm wishing to add to the game :D

content: Loving this! Stumbled across it on Google Apps and well worth the £3! Look so simple but so much depth. Love the pet and crafting systems and shear wealth of options and resources to collect and use. Only three or four islands in so far but hoping it will keep me going for a while. Have to admit I am playing with the 'No permadeath' option turned on but really love this game, good work!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! I'm glad you like it and don't worry, when I play it, I use to play it 'No permadeath' too hehe :D

content: It's a pretty fun game, I recommend you make the random monster generation tied to their level, because it's weird how easy it is to fight a CR 19 Balor with a common wooden sword and wooden underwear. Also gear generation being tied to the gear level would be cool, that way you don't keep finding new wooden swords that are better than the metal ones you have.
replyContent: Hello! Thanks for your review! I'll try to improve the balance of the monsters in next updates, so it makes more sense :) Hope you keep playing and enjoy it! :D

content: Great game! It builds nicely on the first, and seeing active dev on features and tweaks is quite nice!
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your review!!! :D

content: The game is fine but balance is questionable. Sometimes I take 1 damage from a monster at a given level while another mob at the same level will hit me for 75-90% of my health.
replyContent: Hello! I'm still working a lot on it trying to make the game better in every update :) I'm going to improve it, but, as you may have seen, there're different types of monsters, and, even if they are the same level, they can have different stats (you can check their base stats in the collections screen). I wish you'd give it another opportunity :)

content: Loved the first one. Can't wait to try this!
replyContent: Hope you like it even more than the first one!!! :D

content: Fantastic game!
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! :D

content: This takes me back to some of the better *band games such as ToME and Chengband. Congrats on such an in depth, deceptively simple game. I've only been playing a few minutes, so I'm sure I'll have more later. :D Edit: Is there an easier way to contact? I swore off Reddit...
replyContent: Argh! I'll change the Learnt word then, thanks!!! And thanks for your nice feedback! :D

content: I haven't even launched the game but i'm willing to give 5 stars on inertia from version 1! I can't say enough how excited I was to see a sequel to such an excellent game! You certainly understand and have captured the spirit of the genre going back to the classics! Thanks so much for your work in this undertaking! Well done and keep up the great work!
replyContent: Thanks a lot for this amazing feedback!!!! Glad you like it and hope you enjoy playing it! :D

content: A worthy part two! The interface is cleaner and easy to use. Also, the introduction of crafting makes the game more engaging. If you liked the first one, you will enjoy and want to play the the second edition of the game.
replyContent: Thanks!!!! :D

content: Whoa, I loved the first game, I remember emailing the developer about it. So glad i happened to see you made a sequel! Instant buy!
replyContent: Thanks a lot David!!!!!! :D

content: Better than the original, and definitely worth the money. I thoroughly enjoy the new content thus far
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your kind words!!!! I'm glad you enjoy it!!! :D

content: To be frank, this game is a tough cookie. In a good way. It makes me think I'm my ties, their is a learning curve, and their is much to do. I will recommend to all. Worth every penny!
replyContent: Thank you!!!!! :D

content: i have to say if u don't play this game u are truely missing out on and awesome and true title that will have u returning for weeks, months and possiblely even years to come. i still play part 1. and do not by any means regret getting part 2. so much to do and more ware even the ideas or things u can do is endless. keep up awesome work.
replyContent: Thanks a lot boss!!!!!! ;)

content: Great job, works better with large tablets, UI is more straightforward, plays better. Having lots of fun, worth every prenny!
replyContent: Thanks a lot, and I'm really happy it works nice with tablet, I made some updates to improve it (because I focused my development on smartphones), so that's very nice to read! :)

content: Excellent sequel so far! My only real complaint is the base crafting materials being ... well, so random or in short supply. I really enjoyed crafting stuff in the first just to DO it but now with things like firepits taking 3 mats you might not have (I didn't have a single stone on my first island?!) and certain mats being RNG recipe drops (it took a couple of hours to find leather!) it's a littlw frustrating. This coincedentally makes the hunger system an annoying slog.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your feedback! I will try to improve the crafting system and increase the number of materials (I have an idea for the future where some special kind of monster will drop a specific type of material). Also, I may add a way to always be able to have at least one Rock to mine in the first island. Thanks a lot for the suggestions! :D

content: I really love it. I played in first one a lot, and when I found out that you released this one, I immediately decided to buy it. And yeah, it worth it.
replyContent: Thanks a lot!!!! :D

content: Honestly this was 100% worth the money. I loved the first game but this one is absolutely perfect. The new weapon mastery system and pet system/ability to start out with a pet and tame anything is a MASSIVE plus for me. This game is also a lot harder than the first one, pretty impressed by the spike and being challenged a lot more! Edit: This developer has proven again and again that they're willing to listen to and impliment our ideas from discord. If you're not playing yet you should ❤💜
replyContent: Thank you for your nice review! I'm glad you like it! Feel free to send me your ideas whenever you want! :)

content: The game is amazing. I like how the overworld are islands and not the typical dungeons. Will there be 2 tilesets in the future to choose from? There is a roguelike called Cogmind that offers 2 tilesets one being symbolic(ascii) and realistic(with simple sprites) I think having such an option will allow this game to reach a wider audience. Thank you for your time and great game.
replyContent: Thanks for your nice review and your suggestion! I've thought about tiles a few times but never decided to go for it, but I don't discard trying it in the future! Let's see how it goes, and if I do it, I hope people like it :D

content: It took me several tries learning to survive past character lvl 1. Then, I had a great character going up to lvl 8. Extra gold, on the way to buying anything I wanted. Then, I traveled to a new island. I was cocky. Then guess what happened? That's right; PERMADEATH! No el problemo. I was real happy to learn the rudiments of the game, and start to get a working idea of skills and crafting. Basically, this is an endless random dungeon quest without the hassle of complex mazes.
replyContent: Hahaha thanks a lot for your nice review!!! It can be difficult in permadeath mode, but it's my favorite way of playing, so you feel the risk of losing everything at every step you make :) Enjoy!!

content: Enjoyable roguelike, definitely a bit different than the usual dungeon crawl style as this game takes an open world approach and does a stellar job providing numerous avenues for the player to explore including a crafting system and the ability to sail to new islands. I look forward to seeing what the developer has in store for future updates.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your awesome review! Glad you enjoy the game :)

content: ... Why did I do it? L25, still young but had so much going for me. My stash was full, my bank was overflowing. So much knowledge at my fingertips.... To... a sea horse? I threw it all away because i was too impatient to chug one of my 10 250hp heal potions? WHY DID I HIT ATTACK?!?!?! How could I let a SEA HORSE kill me?! 5/5. will permadeath again :D
replyContent: Hahaha if it makes you feel better, this also happens to me sometimes when I'm doing a test run :) Thanks for sharing your experience! :D

content: Due to the quick response of the developer and my general love of this game im posting a five star review after my earlier four star review. Thanks for your diligence 👍
replyContent: I'll take note of this! Will try to keep adding more details to the game so it feels more alive :D Thanks for your review! :)

content: I really loved the first RAR and this one is even better! Graphics are basically non-existent but that isn't at all a detriment to this game. It's well thought out and surprisingly addictive!
replyContent: Thanks so much for this!!! I really am happy people are enjoying the game so much!!! :D

content: Very challenging. Just like the last one! So much more to explore. Totally worth getting if you dont care about graphics. The best game on the store for a loonng time. Keep up the great work Archison!!
replyContent: Thanks a lot for the super nice review!!!!!! :D

content: The piano music is so good! The game is really fun,and at first I kept dying a lot not noticing the hunger bar. :p
replyContent: Thanks!!!! It was very fun to compose the music and also develop the game, glad you like it! :)

content: Thanks for stealing my time. This game is awesome! It's these kinds of game i love where there are lots to do, simple and not a big moneygrabber (IAPs)
replyContent: Hahaha glad you like it! Enjoy!!! Thanks a lot for your review :)

content: Good throwback to old text adventure games
replyContent: Thanks a lot Murph!!! :D

content: Better than the original! I like the improvements. I don't think the UI is as user friendly as it could be, but this is a great pick up and play game that will help extend my bathroom breaks for the next few months...
replyContent: Thank you!!!! :D About the UI, could you send me a private mail (or maybe throught the subreddit or Discord) suggestions so I can make it even better? I really appreciate all the feedback, suggestions and ideas! Thanks a lot! :)

content: It is surprisingly good. A nice improvement from RAR1. I am glad that there are so many things added and/or changed from RAR1. I am playing warrior and for me warrior is pretty overpowered early game and I love playing warrior. I also loved that the enemies uses special skills that may tip the battle to their favor and the player also have that option through weapon masteries. The game is a lot more unpredictable and more complicated and I love that. I am hoping for many updates in the future.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your super review! I will try to make it even better with the next updates I'm working on! :D

content: Just bought it and spent about 30 minutes playing and already I'm liking the game. The music is a vast improvement from the last game and the look of the game is more smooth and polished. So far I'm enjoying myself and can't wait to see more stuff added to the game. Nice work Dev! Edit: thank you for fixing the minimap in the game! That was the only thing that was slightly bugging me but I figured it was a graphical choice and I adjusted to it but now it isn't an issue. Thanks again!
replyContent: Thank you!!! I'm happy you like it more than the first one!! 😁

content: this is a awesome game! I bought it and was at first frustrated because I kept dying and I didn't know why, but then I figured out why I was dying, and after I had, the game forced me to strategize, having to go back to the bar and sometimes the inn once inn a while (get it?) which was a nice break from the usual rogue-like senseless killing. thanks for this game, and keep up the awesome work!
replyContent: Hahaha thanks for your review, inn my opinion, one of the most fun I've read :D Thanks!!!

content: Encountered a bug that appears to have perma broken one of the save slots: Permadeath , died fron hunger at lvl 1. After clicking the restart button it took me to title screen, but slot 1 says 'continue'. Clicking this causesthe game to hang in a neverwnding load cycle. Otherwise...good game!
replyContent: Hi! I think I've been able to fix it :) I will update the game today (I'm not sure how long will it take to be live). Thanks for your feedback! EDIT: I think it's already live! :)

content: I wasted night after night with the free version of the first game and happily upgraded to pro to waste some more time, and now its time to do it again! I can't sing enough praises about this sequel, which gives the original a fresh coat of paint, and more! As stated in a previous review, this works well with talkback, and the memorization of the symbols and their meanings is a non-issue for me. I'm really happy to see that I'm not the only one to hold this game in high regards. Keep it up! :)
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your very nice review, I really am glad you enjoy the game and that you appreciate it being able to work with google talkback :) I hope you play a lot and keep having fun with it :D Good luck!

content: This game has such promise. I highly reccomend this game if you like roguelike games with an RPG feel. The randomness makes the replayability of the game enjoyable.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your nice review! It's being really nice to see the game is being so well received by you all! <3

content: Amazing sequel some bugs here and there but honestly an improvement
replyContent: Thank you!! If you could send me those bugs privately (mail or with the feedback form), it'd be great! I'll fix everything I can! :)

content: I am loving this game!
replyContent: Thanks!!!😄

content: High quality roguelike with lots of challenges and builds. Highly recommend.
replyContent: Thanks!!! Enjoy it and don't hesitate to give me more feedback :)

content: Works with Google talk back. A great game to play to kill some time.
replyContent: Glad you like it and love they you can play with Google talk back! 🥰
